update.description:
this allows ConfigWidgets to parse and create widgets for configuring fields of enum type via a Qt combo box. 

Added a JointMsgWidget test in ConfigWidget_TEST that makes use of the new functions. Specifically   the joint `type` field is an enum in joint.proto. The test shows setting and getting joint type values (as well as testing and verifying all other joint fields).

The is needed later by a new joint inspector I am creating for model editor.
update.title: Supprt enum values in ConfigWidget

content.raw: true, need to add more checks. I ticketed issue #1520 for now and will address this as a whole separately
content.html: true, need to add more checks. I ticketed issue #1520 for now and will address this as a whole separately

content.raw:
Here you go, how does this look

![rgb_text.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/2371004424-rgb_text.png)
content.html: Here you go, how does this look

content.raw:
Thanks for checking! I guess we might as well start heading in the Material Design direction...Their primary red is #F44336, blue: #2196F3, green: #4CAF50

Can I have a look before you finalize? Could look weird...
content.html:
Thanks for checking! I guess we might as well start heading in the Material Design direction...Their primary red is #F44336, blue: #2196F3, green: #4CAF50

Can I have a look before you finalize? Could look weird...

content.raw: @spaepcke do you have preferred RGB values for the colors red, green and blue to be used on text labels?
content.html: @spaepcke do you have preferred RGB values for the colors red, green and blue to be used on text labels?

content.raw: How about returning a bool to indicate if the the value was set?
content.html: How about returning a bool to indicate if the the value was set?

content.raw: Fixes issue #1499
content.html: Fixes issue #1499

content.raw: Maybe use a type with a different number of axes to make sure that's handled well? Would it be too much to test both increasing and decreasing number of axes? For example revolute -> universal -> ball?
content.html: Maybe use a type with a different number of axes to make sure that's handled well? Would it be too much to test both increasing and decreasing number of axes? For example revolute -> universal -> ball?

content.raw: /// \param[in] _values
content.html: /// \param[in] _values

content.raw: There are many pointers in this class being used without being checked, I wonder how often we should be checking them...
content.html: There are many pointers in this class being used without being checked, I wonder how often we should be checking them...

content.raw: Maybe check if `enumDescriptor != NULL` and `enumValue != NULL`?
content.html: Maybe check if enumDescriptor != NULL and enumValue != NULL?

content.raw: Also, since we're changing XYZ, shouldn't we change RGB as well?
content.html: Also, since we're changing XYZ, shouldn't we change RGB as well?

content.raw:
These colours are a bit hard to see for me. I'm not sure exactly how I would change them though.

![xyzrgb.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/3730441132-xyzrgb.png)
content.html: These colours are a bit hard to see for me. I'm not sure exactly how I would change them though.
